content: The "New Skills for New Jobs Act" allows for federal matching payments for state new jobs training tax credits. The "New Skills for New Jobs Act" authorizes the Treasury Secretary to make quarterly payments to eligible community colleges based on new job tax withholding matches for trainees. Eligible community colleges are defined as public higher education institutions. The "New Skills for New Jobs Act" authorizes payments to eligible community colleges based on job tax withholding matches for trainees. Eligible colleges offer associate's degrees, participate in State new jobs training tax credit programs, and have contracts meeting specific requirements. The "New Skills for New Jobs Act" allows State income taxes withheld by the employer for eligible trainees to be remitted to the community college for education payment. This payment will be considered as if it was remitted to the State for tax liability purposes. The employer must hire individuals from an eligible community college for full-time employment within the State. These individuals must be paid a wage that is at least 175 percent of the Federal minimum wage or the amount specified by the State program. The employer will also remit State income taxes withheld on behalf of the employees as per the State program.
